snippet: The annual frenzy of discount shopping — to the tune of more than $14 billion in 24 hours – offers a way into the country’s growing middle-class market, companies say.
abstract: Many foreign companies tap into frenzied shopping that occurs in China on November 11, known as singles day, through online marketplaces Tmall, part of Alibaba, and JD.com; online outlets have allowed foreign companies to take portion of billions of dollars in sales and given them access to growing Chinese middle class.

byline.original: By AMIE TSANG and CAO LI
byline.contributor: Amie Tsang reported from Hong Kong and Cao Li from Beijing. Paul Mozur contributed reporting from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: The annual frenzy of discount shopping — to the tune of more than $14 billion in 24 hours – offers a way into the country’s growing middle-class market, companies say.

headline.main: Singles Day in China Draws New Suitors: Foreign Sellers
headline.print_headline: A Day of Buying in China Attracts Foreign Vendors
